class.name: ServiceDialog
class.javadoc:
A class which implements a cross-platform print dialog.
Chris Campbell
Waiting print status (user response pending).
Approve print status (user activated "Print" or "OK").
Cancel print status (user activated "Cancel");
Constructor for the "standard" print dialog (containing all relevant tabs)
Constructor for the "standard" print dialog (containing all relevant tabs)
Initialize print dialog.
Constructor for the solitary "page setup" dialog
Constructor for the solitary "page setup" dialog
Initialize "page setup" dialog
Performs Cancel when Esc key is pressed.
Returns the current status of the dialog (whether the user has selected the "Print" or "Cancel" button)

Returns an AttributeSet based on whether or not the user cancelled the dialog. If the user selected "Print" we return their new selections, otherwise we return the attributes that were passed in initially.
Returns a PrintService based on whether or not the user cancelled the dialog. If the user selected "Print" we return the user's selection for the PrintService, otherwise we return null.
Sets the current status flag for the dialog and disposes it (thus returning control of the parent frame back to the user)
Displays a JFileChooser that allows the user to select the destination for "Print To File"
Updates each of the top level panels
Initialize ResourceBundle
Returns message string from resource
Returns mnemonic character from resource
Returns the mnemonic as a KeyEvent.VK constant from the resource.
Returns URL for image resource
Creates a new JButton and sets its text, mnemonic, and ActionListener
Creates a new JButton and sets its text, and ActionListener
Creates a new JCheckBox and sets its text, mnemonic, and ActionListener
Creates a new JRadioButton and sets its text, mnemonic, and ActionListener
Creates a pop-up dialog for "no print service"
Sets the constraints for the GridBagLayout and adds the Component to the given Container
Adds the AbstractButton to both the given ButtonGroup and Container

class.name: GeneralPanel
class.javadoc: The "General" tab. Includes the controls for PrintService, PageRange, and Copies/Collate.

class.name: PrintServicePanel
class.javadoc: We disable the "Print To File" checkbox if this returns false
Break this out as it may be useful when we allow API to specify printing to a file. In that case its probably right to throw a SecurityException if the permission is not granted.

class.name: PageSetupPanel
class.javadoc: The "Page Setup" tab. Includes the controls for MediaSource/MediaTray, OrientationRequested, and Sides.

class.name: AppearancePanel
class.javadoc: The "Appearance" tab. Includes the controls for Chromaticity, PrintQuality, JobPriority, JobName, and other related job attributes.

class.name: IconRadioButton
class.javadoc: A special widget that groups a JRadioButton with an associated icon, placed to the left of the radio button.

class.name: ValidatingFileChooser
class.javadoc: Similar in functionality to the default JFileChooser, except this chooser will pop up a "Do you want to overwrite..." dialog if the user selects a file that already exists.
